## Summary

This PR implements support for passing the `--auto-continue` option from the `hive` command down to `solve.mjs`, addressing issue #272.

## Changes Made

- âœ… Added `--auto-continue` option to hive.mjs yargs configuration
- âœ… Pass the option to solve.mjs when spawning worker processes
- âœ… Display auto-continue status in monitoring configuration output
- âœ… Added unit test to verify the implementation

## Implementation Details

The `--auto-continue` option allows the hive command to automatically continue with existing PRs for issues if they are older than 24 hours. This option is now properly passed down to solve.mjs when processing issues.

### Key changes in `src/hive.mjs`:
1. Added the option definition in the yargs configuration
2. Added logic to push `--auto-continue` to the arguments array when spawning solve.mjs
3. Added status display when auto-continue is enabled
4. Included the flag in command logging for transparency

## Test Plan

- [x] Created unit test (`tests/test-hive-auto-continue.mjs`) that verifies:
  - The option is properly defined in yargs configuration
  - The flag is correctly passed to solve.mjs
  - The flag variable is properly defined
  - The flag is included in command logging
  - Auto-continue status is displayed in monitoring output
- [x] All unit tests pass successfully
- [x] Verified the option appears in `--help` output

## How to Use

```bash
# Enable auto-continue when running hive
hive https://github.com/owner/repo --auto-continue
```

When enabled, the monitoring output will show:
```
ðŸ”„ Auto-Continue: ENABLED (will continue with existing PRs older than 24 hours)
```

Fixes #272
